tools.title: Conservation Data Centre
tools.content:
The BC Conservation Data Centre (CDC) maps known locations of species and ecological communities at risk. CDC occurrence data is updated nightly. Visit this site often for new occurrence information.

Absence of occurrence records in an area of interest does not necessarily mean that there are no species or ecosystems at risk present; only that there are none currently recorded in the database. A detailed assessment of the property conducted during the appropriate season is the only way to confirm presence or absence of species or ecosystems at risk.

Masked Secured Occurrences: for details of these records please contact the CDC atcdcdata@gov.bc.ca and include your project details and area of interest.

Tips:

  • To "zoom" to an address or place name, use the "Search" window above.
  • To turn on and off available layers choose the "Layers" tab below. You can also add additional DataBC layers or your own shapefiles.
  • To reduce confusion display one occurrence layer at a time.

For more detailed instructions, data field definitions and information about occurrence methodology: click here.
 
Download the complete publicly available occurrence dataset via the Data Distribution Service application. Search for "conservation data centre".

For help with CDC occurrences and how to use this application contact the CDC:cdcdata@gov.bc.ca
To report technical difficulties contact the Service Desk: NRSApplications@gov.bc.ca
